column1: Xorddos-Intezer,bin/,“/bin/sh”.,125,"if a shell is requested via the command code 3000, the malware creates a new thread executing “/bin/sh”."
Xorddos-Intezer,bin/,pty;pty.spawn(‘/bin/sh’)”,126,"in the new spawned shell, the malware executes python -c “import pty;pty.spawn(‘/bin/sh’)” to get a pseudo-terminal (pty) interface."

Xorddos-Microsoft,resolv.conf,resolv.conf.,87,"to spoof its process name, xorddos zeroes out all argument buffers while running and overrides its first argument buffer containing the image path with a fake command line, such as cat resolv.conf."

iterates list of all hidden ports and deletes all entries

deletes a provided entry from accept_ips list

column1: Xorddos-Microsoft,/proc/,/proc/$pid,114,"a user-mode process can get any process specific information by reading the /proc directory that contains the subdirectory for each running process on the system, such as:
running the strace -e open ps command checks the traces of the open call on /proc/$pid to fetch information on running processes as part of the ps command."
if the malware hides the $pid specific directory, it can conceal fetching the corresponding process from a user mode."

Xorddos-Microsoft,/proc/,/proc/rs_dev,116,"in this case, the malware has a provision for communicating with its rootkit component /proc/rs_dev by sending input and output control (ioctl) calls with additional information to take appropriate action."
Xorddos-Microsoft,/proc/,/proc/net,124,the /proc/net interface provides information about currently active tcp connections and is implemented by kernel apis tcp4_seq_show() and tcp6_seq_show() .
Xorddos-Microsoft,/proc/,/proc/net/udp.,125,"utilities, such as netstat, acquire tcp/udp connection information from files named /proc/net/tcp and /proc/net/udp."

Xorddos-Microsoft,bin/,/bin/,179,"4: known locations code path without any provided arguments
this code path is similar to the standard code path, with the main difference being that the malware runs from one of the following locations:
once it runs from one of these locations, the malware calls the following functions to perform various tasks:
installsys – this function sets up the rootkit by extracting it under /usr/bin folder using a random name and loading it into the kernel."

Xorddos-Microsoft,0x[0-9a-zA-Z]{8},0xbb2fa36aaa9541f0.,182,"as mentioned in the xor-based encryption section, the encoded string m7a4nq_/na translates to the folder path /usr/bin when decoded with the multi-byte key 0xbb2fa36aaa9541f0."
